author: greystroke
content: Any thoughts on deprecating the creation of new 0x00 & 0x01 type validators in a future hard fork?

author: celtic.warrior
content: If 0x02 was properly designed, 0x01 might no longer be needed.  0x00 is more of a legacy issue in that some of those that were created early on do not have withdrawal addresses set, so an enforced migration would be quite challenging.

author: greystroke
content:
I was more thinking not to enforce migration (which not even possible for those 0x00 who lost their keys) but consider making new 0x00 & 0x01 validator type impossible to make. 
Ideally, that would be combined with a redesign of 0x02 validators similar to the original design proposal where the maximum validator size is a variable staker set number.
